tn.text: Many verses in Chapter 11 are contrasting parallelisms (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: Yahweh hates scales that are not accurate
tn.text: "Scales" represent measuring accurately in negotiating. AT: "God hates deceiving scales" or "God hates it when people are deceitful" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: but he delights in a precise weight
tn.text: "Precise weight" represents accuracy in negotiating. AT: "but he delights in honest ways" or "but he is happy when people are honest"
This nominal adjective can be stated as an adjective. AT: "treacherous people" or "those who are treacherous" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])

tn.ref: Wealth is worthless on the day of wrath
tn.text: The "day of wrath" represents a specific event, such as the "day of Yahweh" or "judgment day" or "last days." AT: "A person's wealth will do him no good when God comes to judge." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"has clear direction"
These nominal adjectives can be stated as adjectives. AT: "those who are wicked ... those who are treacherous" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])

tn.ref: the treacherous are trapped by their cravings
tn.text: "those who do evil are captured by their passions"
ready to betray trust; traitorous; deceptive

tn.ref: the hope that was in his strength
tn.text: "the confidence he has in his own power"
"disappears"

tn.ref: The righteous person is kept away from trouble
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God keeps away from trouble the person who does what is right" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"trouble comes"
"Mouth" represents what a person says. AT: "The words of the godless" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"City" represents the community or people group. AT: "the people group prospers" or "the community becomes prosperous" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: by the mouth of the wicked
tn.text: "Mouth" represents what a person says. AT: "the words of evil people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"Covered" represents keeping things concealed as much as possible. AT: "does not tell" or "does not speak about the matter" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
those who give recommendations as a guide to action; counselors
"one who refuses to give"
people without pity or compassion; cruel people
"are greedy for wealth"
"a person who"
To "sow" represents spreading out to gain more. AT: "spreads out what is right" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
To "reap" represents acquiring or gathering in" AT: "will surely be rewarded" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"the person who"
"chases after evil" or "seeks to do evil"
"Heart" represents the feelings, attitudes and motivations of a person. AT: "who have wicked thoughts" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"will be punished" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]])

tn.ref: Like a gold ring ... without discretion
tn.text: A beautiful woman without discretion is compared to a useless and unsuitable golden ring in a pig's nose. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
" without common sense" or "who is foolish"
"Sowing seed" represents preparing for the future. AT: "a person who prepares for the future" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"will gain even more"
"Sow" represents preparing for a result. AT: "does not prepare" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"will gain more"
"the generous person who" or "anyone who"

tn.ref: the man who refuses to sell
tn.text: This describes the person who hoards his wealth instead of helping those in need.

tn.ref: good gifts crown the head of him who sells it
tn.text: "Crown" represents the reward or award for the person who is willing to sell grain. AT: "good gifts are given as a crown of honor to him who sells it" or "the person who sells it is honored with many blessings" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
the one who seeks with careful and continued effort
This is an idiom. Here "fall" represents destruction or failure. AT: "will be destroyed" or "awaits a bad future" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: like the leaf, righteous people will flourish
tn.text: "Leaf" represents growth and prosperity. AT: "righteous people will prosper in the same way a healthy green leaf grows" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
This means that righteous people will thrive or prosper.
The "wind" is something that cannot be grasped. AT: "inherit nothing." (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: The righteous will be like a tree of life
tn.text: A person who does what is right is compared to a tree that produces life as its fruit. AT: "Those who do right will bring life to themselves and others" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
Translate this as in [[:en:bible:notes:pro:03:17|3:18]].
"even more so"
